message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms suggest a viral infection, and among the options, enveloped (+) ssRNA viruses are most commonly associated with the common cold.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and exam findings suggest a viral infection, and among the options, only Enveloped (+) ssRNA viruses cause such symptoms, including the common cold.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms of sore throat, runny nose, cough and mild fever suggest a viral infection, and among the options, only enveloped (+) ssRNA viruses are known to cause such symptoms. Common examples of these viruses include rhinovirus and coronavirus, which are responsible for the common cold.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms described suggest a respiratory viral infection. Among the options, envelope (+) ssRNA viruses, such as rhinovirus and coronavirus, are commonly associated with upper respiratory tract infections.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms described suggest a viral infection, and among the options, only enveloped (+) ssRNA viruses are associated with the common cold. These include rhinoviruses, coronaviruses, and respiratory syncytial virus.
We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, only enveloped (+) ssRNA viruses cause the common cold, which is the most likely cause of the patient’s illness.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms, including mild fevers, sore throat, runny nose, and cough, are most likely caused by an enveloped (+) ssRNA virus, such as the common cold or influenza viruses. Enveloped (-) ssRNA viruses, such as the Ebola virus, can cause much more severe symptoms. Nonenveloped dsRNA and dsDNA viruses typically cause different types of infections, such as gastroenteritis or warts.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms suggest a viral infection, and among the given options, only enveloped (+) ssRNA viruses can cause respiratory infections such as the common cold.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and the fact that it’s a self-limited viral infection suggest that a virus is the most likely cause. Among the options, enveloped (+) ssRNA viruses such as rhinoviruses and coronaviruses are the most common causes of upper respiratory infections.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms suggest a viral infection, and among the options, enveloped (+) ssRNA viruses are the most common cause of respiratory infections, including the common cold, such as rhinovirus, coronaviruses, and respiratory syncytial virus.
